[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [General] [Unknown field injection] Can attackers inject unknown protobuf fields that get silently ignored but cause issues when messages are re-serialized? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [General] [Protobuf varint overflow] Can malicious varint-encoded fields in protobuf messages overflow during decoding, causing integer wraparound vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [General] [Default value confusion] Do optional fields with default values create ambiguity between 'not set' and 'set to default', allowing security checks to be bypassed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [General] [Message size limits] Are there global message size limits enforced during protobuf deserialization, or can arbitrarily large messages cause OOM? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [General] [Repeated field limits] Are repeated field counts bounded to prevent memory exhaustion from messages with millions of repeated elements? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [General] [String length limits] Are string field lengths bounded, or can multi-megabyte strings in address/module/function fields cause memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [General] [Oneof exhaustiveness] Does pattern matching on oneof enums handle all variants exhaustively, or can new variants added in protobuf updates cause panics? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [General] [Clone performance] Can malicious messages with many large repeated fields exploit expensive Clone operations to cause DoS? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [General] [PartialEq bypass] Can messages that should be distinct have PartialEq return true due to uninitialized optional fields, allowing duplicate detection bypass? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Integration] [RawData service stream exhaustion] Can clients abuse the RawData::GetTransactions streaming RPC to open thousands of concurrent streams, exhausting server connection pools? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Integration] [GrpcManager routing attacks] Can malicious GrpcManager heartbeats redirect client traffic to attacker-controlled indexer services? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Integration] [DataService service selection] Does GetDataServiceForRequest properly authenticate requests, or can unauthenticated attackers query service topology? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Integration] [Chain ID inconsistency] Can different services (live, historical, fullnode) report conflicting chain_id values, causing cross-chain contamination? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Integration] [Version gap exploitation] If min_servable_version leaves gaps in available versions, can attackers exploit unavailable version ranges for exploits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Integration] [Filter evaluation order] Can malicious filter combinations exploit evaluation order to cause different results on different nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Integration] [Service health spoofing] Can malicious services send fake health indicators (known_latest_version, stream_info) to win load balancing selection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Integration] [Timestamp monotonicity] Are timestamps validated to be monotonically increasing across service updates, preventing time-rollback attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Include: serde.rs] [JSON deserialization] Can the included serde.rs file introduce JSON deserialization vulnerabilities when converting protobuf messages to/from JSON? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Include: serde.rs] [Field name confusion] Can serde's #[serde(rename)] attributes cause field name mismatches between protobuf and JSON, leading to type confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Include: serde.rs] [Integer precision loss] Can large u64 values lose precision when serialized to JSON (which uses f64 for numbers), causing version/count corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Include: serde.rs] [Optional field ambiguity] Do serde's optional field encodings (null vs absent) match protobuf semantics, or can this mismatch cause security issues? (Medium)
